ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC FMTC2ITM <options>; 
    <SELECT member-list>; 
    
The FMTC2ITM procedure converts one or more format catalogs into a single item store that can be made 
available to CAS. PROC FMTC2ITM enables you to create an item store that has the following contents: 

  o all of the formats from one catalog 
  o a subset of the formats from one catalog 
  o all of the formats from multiple catalogs 
  o a subset of the formats from each of multiple catalogs.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CATALOG= memname | libname.memname | (list)
      
Specifies a catalog that is to be converted to an item store. If you do not specify the CATALOG 
option, the default catalog is WORK.FORMATS.

Syntax: ITEMSTORE= fileref | 'filename'
      
Specifies the name of the item store. You can specify a fileref, or you can specify a pathname 
in quotation marks.

Syntax: ENCODING=encoding-name
      
Specifies an encoding for a catalog or for all of the catalogs in a list.
Displays information about each catalog member that is written.
Adds locale-sensitive prefixes to the names of members of an item store.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax:  SELECT <member-list>;
      
Lists the formats to place in the item store. If you do not specify the members of the format catalog 
with a SELECT statement, then all formats in the catalog are written to the item store.

Optional Argument
member-list
  Contains the names of the formats to place in the item store.
